question: Gian khổ, khó khăn, đòi hỏi nhiều nỗ lực.
example: Such an endeavor would be too arduous.
english-definition: Difficult, needing a lot of effort and energy.

question: Đạt được, giành được.
example: When they were finished, they had attained a perfect skeleton.
english-definition: To reach or succeed in getting something.

question: Cùng tồn tại, chung sống.
example: They couldn’t coexist peacefully because their egos were too large.
english-definition: To live or exist together at the same time or in the same place.

question: Hình dung, tưởng tượng, nhận thức.
example: Tim couldn’t conceive a plan to remove the huge skeleton all by himself.
english-definition: To imagine something.

question: Đáng ngờ, không chắc chắn, mơ hồ.
example: Dean thought that Tim’s claim might be dubious.
english-definition: Thought not to be completely true or not able to be trusted.

question: Cái tôi, lòng tự trọng.
example: They couldn’t coexist peacefully because their egos were too large.
english-definition: Your idea or opinion of yourself, especially your feeling of your own importance and ability.

question: Dây thun, chất co giãn.
example: And to keep the bones together, they tied them with elastic strips.
english-definition: A type of rubber that is able to stretch and return to its original size.

question: Sự nỗ lực, sự cố gắng.
example: Such an endeavor would be too arduous.
english-definition: An attempt to do something.

question: Khắc, chạm trổ.
example: They engraved their initials into it and gave it to the curator of a local museum.
english-definition: To cut words, pictures, or patterns into the surface of a hard object.

question: Đào, khai quật.
example: He took his shovel and carefully excavated the dirt around it.
english-definition: To remove earth that is covering very old objects buried in the ground in order to discover things about the past.

question: Lởm chởm, có nhiều cạnh sắc nhọn.
example: As he dug, he uncovered more jagged bones.
english-definition: Rough and with sharp points.

question: Nơi chốn, địa điểm (của một sự kiện).
example: Tim excitedly showed Dean the skeleton’s locale.
english-definition: A place where something happens or is set, or that has particular events associated with it.

question: Khuôn đúc.
example: They used plaster to make a mold of the dinosaur’s skull.
english-definition: A hollow container with a particular shape into which you pour a liquid substance so that it will become a solid in that shape.

question: Hoàn toàn, thẳng thừng, dứt khoát.
example: Although Tim and Dean were quite similar, they were outright enemies.
english-definition: Complete and total.

question: Vùng ngoại vi, vùng ven, chu vi.
example: One day, Tim was searching for fossils on the periphery of the city when he discovered a huge bone.
english-definition: The outer edge of an area.

question: Thạch cao.
example: They used plaster to make a mold of the dinosaur’s skull.
english-definition: A substance that becomes hard as it dries and is used especially for covering walls and ceilings and for making sculptures.

question: Cái xẻng.
example: He took his shovel and carefully excavated the dirt around it.
english-definition: A tool consisting of a wide, square metal blade attached to a handle, used for moving coal, earth, snow, etc.

question: Thuộc về bộ xương, gầy trơ xương.
example: I’ve found the skeletal remains of a huge terrestrial animal.
english-definition: Relating to the skeleton.

question: (Sống) trên cạn, thuộc về trái đất.
example: ...the skeletal remains of a huge terrestrial animal.
english-definition: Relating to the Earth or to land; living on land.

question: Hung dữ, xấu xa, tàn bạo.
example: The two men got into vicious arguments all the time.
english-definition: Vicious people or actions show an intention or wish to hurt someone or something very badly.
